intro: Kalanchoe viguieri var. latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepal kalanchoe, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, thick leaves that store water, typical of many succulents. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow during the winter months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright sunlight. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
